message_1:
A company collected data on the number of products sold per day for the past 30 days. The data can be found in the following table:

Day | Number of Products Sold
----|-----------------------
1   | 10
2   | 13
3   | 12
4   | 11
5   | 9
6   | 15
7   | 16
8   | 12
9   | 11
10  | 14
11  | 10
12  | 12
13  | 13
14  | 14
15  | 16
16  | 18
17  | 11
18  | 9
19  | 12
20  | 13
21  | 15
22  | 14
23  | 17
24  | 16
25  | 13
26  | 12
27  | 10
28  | 11
29  | 9
30  | 13

What is the mean and median number of products sold per day?
message_2:
To find the mean, we need to sum up the number of products sold per day and divide by the total number of days (30).

Mean = (10 + 13 + 12 + 11 + 9 + 15 + 16 + 12 + 11 + 14 + 10 + 12 + 13 + 14 + 16 + 18 + 11 + 9 + 12 + 13 + 15 + 14 + 17 + 16 + 13 + 12 + 10 + 11 + 9 + 13) / 30
Mean = 366 / 30
Mean = 12.2

To find the median, we need to list the number of products sold per day in ascending order and find the middle value(s).

Sorted list: 9, 9, 9, 10, 10, 10, 11, 11, 11, 11, 12, 12, 12, 12, 12, 13, 13, 13, 13, 13, 14, 14, 14, 14, 15, 15, 16, 16, 16, 18

Since there are 30 days, an even number, the median will be the average of the two middle values (12th and 13th values in the sorted list).

Median = (12 + 12) / 2
Median = 24 / 2
Median = 12

So, the mean number of products sold per day is 12.2, and the median number of products sold per day is 12.
